intro: Dicarpellum neocaledonicum, commonly known as the New Caledonian dicarpellum, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae, which includes nutmeg and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and unique leaf structure. It thrives in the humid, shaded understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a critically endangered species.
